com.microsoft.band.tiles.pages

Class FilledPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.band.tiles.pages.PageElement<T>
      • com.microsoft.band.tiles.pages.PagePanel<FilledPanel>
        • com.microsoft.band.tiles.pages.FilledPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public final class FilledPanel
extends PagePanel<FilledPanel>
    Class that represents a Microsoft Band basic container layout element (Should only be used at the root of a layout)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.os.Parcelable

      • CREATOR

        public static final android.os.Parcelable.Creator<FilledPanel> CREATOR

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilledPanel

        public FilledPanel(int originX,
           int originY,
           int width,
           int height)
        Constructor that sets the bounds of this basic container layout
        Parameters:
        originX - The value to set as the X origin of this container layout (Should be set to 0 if parent element is a FlowPanel or a ScrollFlowPanel)
        originY - The value to set as the Y origin of this container layout (Should be set to 0 if parent element is a FlowPanel or a ScrollFlowPanel)
        width - The value to set as the width of this container layout
        height - The value to set as the height of this container layout

      • FilledPanel

        public FilledPanel(int originX,
           int originY,
           int width,
           int height,
           PageElement... elements)
        Constructor that sets the bounds of this basic container layout and adds layout element children

        NOTE: The Z-order of the elements are opposite of the order in which they are inserted. The first element added would have the highest Z-Order and the last element would have the lowest Z-order. This means if elements occupy similar coordinates a lower Z-order element would be physically underneath a higher Z-order, etc.
        Parameters:
        originX - The value to set as the X origin of this container layout (Should be set to 0 if parent element is a FlowPanel or a ScrollFlowPanel)
        originY - The value to set as the Y origin of this container layout (Should be set to 0 if parent element is a FlowPanel or a ScrollFlowPanel)
        width - The value to set as the width of this container layout
        height - The value to set as the height of this container layout
        elements - layout elements to add as children to this container layout

      • FilledPanel

        public FilledPanel(PageRect bound)
        Constructor that sets the bounds of this basic container layout
        Parameters:
        bound - PageRect object for setting the bounds of this container layout

      • FilledPanel

        public FilledPanel(PageRect bound,
           java.util.List<PageElement> elements)
        Constructor that sets the bounds of this basic container layout and adds layout element children.

        NOTE: The Z-order of the non-panel elements are opposite of the order in which they are inserted in the List. The first element added would have the highest Z-Order and the last element would have the lowest Z-order. This means if non-panel elements occupy overlapping coordinates a lower Z-order element would be physically underneath a higher Z-order, etc.
        Parameters:
        bound - PageRect object for setting the bounds of this container layout element
        elements - layout elements to add as children to this container layout

      • FilledPanel

        public FilledPanel(PageRect bound,
           PageElement... elements)
        Constructor that sets the bounds of this basic container layout and adds layout element children

        NOTE: The Z-order of the elements are opposite of the order in which they are inserted. The first element added would have the highest Z-Order and the last element would have the lowest Z-order. This means if elements occupy similar coordinates a lower Z-order element would be physically underneath a higher Z-order, etc.
        Parameters:
        bound - PageRect object for setting the bounds of this container layout
        elements - layout elements to add as children to this container layout

    • Method Detail

      • getBackgroundColor

        public int getBackgroundColor()

        Method to get the explicit background color of this container layout element

        Only useful if the color source is set to ElementColorSource.CUSTOM

        The alpha value of the set color will be ignored and any returned color will always have an alpha of 0xff

        Returns:
        The explicit background color of this container layout element

      • getBackgroundColorSource

        public ElementColorSource getBackgroundColorSource()
        Method to get the background color source of this container layout element
        Returns:
        The background color source of this container layout element

      • setBackgroundColor

        public FilledPanel setBackgroundColor(int color)

        Method to set the explicit background color of this container layout element

        Automatically sets the color source to ElementColorSource.CUSTOM

        Default explicit background color is Color.BLACK

        The alpha value of the set color will be ignored and any returned color will always have an alpha of 0xff

        Parameters:
        color - Color to set as the explicit background color of this container layout element
        Returns:
        this

      • setBackgroundColorSource

        public FilledPanel setBackgroundColorSource(ElementColorSource colorSource)

        Method to set the background color source of this container layout element

        If set to ElementColorSource.CUSTOM, an explicit background color must be provided

        Default is ElementColorSource.CUSTOM with the explicit background color set as Color.BLACK

        Parameters:
        colorSource - ElementColorSource to set as the background color source of this container layout element
        Returns:
        this
